title: Only 4 ADCs have positive winrate.
body:
And I don't like playing any of them so I'm gonna complain about it. 

But seriously though, that doesn't seem healthy at all. 


Edit: I should add that is only 23.5% of ADCs

Edit#2: I based this off of op.gg which I didn't realize was using data from only Korea. Still relevant though

Edit#3: Some people mistook this post to mean that I am saying ADCs in general are too weak. That's not the case, I just wanted to put this statistic out there for discussion.

replies.body: "Dude its an ADC meta"

This doesn't at all mean that ADCs aren't dominant in the current metagame. As Critmaster pointed out, because ADCs almost exclusively go in one position against a single other ADC, their winrates really only are indicative of their power relative to each other, not to the champion pool as a whole.

What this data really tells us is just how ridiculously far out of line the dominant ADCs are right now. While the data is inconsistent between various sites, what is consistent is Ezreal and MF at the top with 54%+ winrates, while the only other "good" ADCs may barely break 51%. So while ADCs as a whole are a problem right now, Ezreal and MF are just especially broken.

So why doesn’t Lucian/Ashe/Trist/Ezreal have good win rates in off roles? Hmm? 

If ADCs are so “out of line”, then they would dominate other roles too? Right? 

But ADCs have shit win rates outside of bot.

Ezreal & Twitch JG hovers 48% w/r EVEN with low pick rates

Trist JG is hilariously bad with 42% w/r. 

Lucian mid sitting at 44%.

Even Quinn is sitting at 49% top - IN A LETHALITY META, she loves the lethality meta. Also Vayne top is like 46%. 

Why are they confined in bot lane if they’re so broken???

They aren't confined to bot lane. The low winrates of off-lane ADCs can be attributed to how much taking a second ADC generally cripples a teamcomp. ADCs are a broken class right now, but luckily they aren't so broken as to make teams able to completely ignore other roles.

So what you’re saying is 0 adc = bad, 1 ADC = good, and 2+ adc = bad.

And somehow they’re a broken class.

This makes no sense. How are they broken if that’s literally what they’re designed for? To be played bot lane (less reliant on XP, more reliant on gold). 

Explain to me how they’re broken, you keep saying they’re broken “just cuz” .

When they are 1 out of 12 clases, and competeing for 1 out of 5 positions, and they get it ***every single time for both teams*** Yes.  That is a problem.  A serious one, we've had for 7 fucking years.

If its been like that for 7 years then why the hell is it a PROBLEM? Its like saying "red buff is a problem, its been here for 7 years".

?????
????

There literally is no logical equivalence. Riot designed the game in a certain way - that's the game you play. It's not a "problem" just because something is part of the game that _you_ personally don't like. 

Riot has designed the game in a certain way PARTICULARLY in a way where they want a marksman in the bottom lane. That design has made their game INCREDIBLY successful, so why should they overhall it, do some Dota-esque shit with increasing turret range blah blah etc when their game is WILDLY successful the way they've made it?

So someone please fucking explain to me why it's a "problem" that adc is a "mandatory" role (it's not even "mandatory" in SoloQ - just optimal, a lot of people climb high playing off-meta shit bot lane).

Also the "1 out of 12 classes" is hilarious too. Why do fighters/bruisers/juggernauts/divers all get seperate classes when they are pretty similar - but all ADCs where a lot of them are vastly different (compare Ezreal (poke) to Jinx (hypercarry), or Lucian (skirmisher) to Ashe (utility)). And they all individually fall in and out of meta
Welcome to Boards.

Ya and of course instead of nerfing the ADCs that are too strong in typical Riot fashion they will buff every other ADC to a broken level further cementing ADC dominance. Meanwhile when a couple of mages are out of line and the rest of the roster sucks balls, what does Riot do? Just nerfs the strong mages.
Ezreal technically got nerfs with this last patch, whether or not they went far enough.  Although I was surprised to see that Miss Fortune didn't even get a love tap.

"because ADCs almost exclusively go in one position against a single other ADC, their winrates really only are indicative of their power relative to each other"

This is an illogical conclusion because ADCs don't fight each other in a vacuum. There are at minimum 4 champions bot lane at any given time, and bot also statistically has the most jungler interaction, bumping that number up to 5 or even 6 champions. That is far too many factors to make "if an ADC loses, that means the other ADC was stronger" a likely correlation.

> [{quoted}](name=Attticus Finch,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=5JAWLQQ0,comment-id=000100010000,timestamp=2017-12-08T06:48:11.654+0000)
>
> because ADCs don't fight each other in a vacuum. 

Except they do, from a statistical standpoint. If one ADC (by position) wins, another ADC (by position) loses. That's just how the game works, so an ADC's winrate by position is only important insofar as it compares to another ADC's winrate by position. This is actually true for every position in the game.

That is far too many factors to make "if an ADC loses, that means the other ADC was stronger" a likely correlation.

In a single game yes, in thousands of games however it is not as you put it an 'illogical conclusion'. Especially in the current state of the game where basically one bot lane wins hard and the other gets crushed and this most of the time decides the game outright.

every game has 2 adc on bot lane. adc are pushing other adc out of the meta. 

this means if some adc have positive winrates and most adc have negative winrates, then those few adc are significantly stronger than the ones with lower winrates.

almost the entire class of champions always lanes against each other every game in the same lane. whichever side wins snowballs to ridiculous levels. most of the time before youve finished an item on top lane, one of the bot lanes is already pushing for an inhib turret or rotating around the map.

hence adc winrates only tell you how adc do against each other, and it doesnt tell you shit about how they compare to the rest of the champion pool.

top lane on the other hand has the largest and most diverse champion pool and is filled with a champion pool of extreme varieties in playstile. top lane is heavily counterpick oriented. even a top laner with a high winrate might not always be the best top laner, and can have a high winrate due to being a counterpick that is only ever picked in response to certain specific other top laners.

on the other hand an adc with a high winrate is usually simply the best adc and shits on all other adc.

yes, at least until next patch where we will be getting bruiser buffs, its still an adc meta because bot lane still has the largest game impact.
Its a bot lane meta, not an ADC meta. Whoever wins bot wins game.

Mages don't need to be in every game. Assassins don't. Enchanters don't. Tanks don't. Bruisers don't. Marksmen do.

A more limited data pool is not better data. This data doesn't include things like regional tendencies and favorites.

Lolalytics says there are 6 botlaners, 5 of whom have relevant pick rates above a 50% winrate, so I'd say the point's still relevant.

True that.  I think they account for lane hard counters,  but I'm not sure they account for enemy ADC factor. For example I could be fed on Morde  but if they have a Vayne or Tristana on the enemy team it's almost a gaurenteed loss for Morde  since I have no way of ever  locking them down during a fight

As Morde, just don't worry about those two then. Let your mid or jungler handle them. Just try to get a slow on them, and ult them before they die if you have the chance to. Focus on beating down the frontline, you have the damage and sustain to do it. You can also nuke their assassins when they jump in, given that the slows you have from Rylai's and Gunblade should *really* fuck them up, and you do damage on-par with them, while having better defenses.

If you can't be useful for one thing, try being useful for something else. If worst comes to worst, go split-push top. They'll need to answer you with multiple people.

See here is the thing about Morde.  He isn't effective vs thier front line.  Killing assassins sure  easy. Frontline not really since his Q damage scales the more damage he deals resistance stack which frontline tanks do. Effectively negate alot of damage by Reducing how much it scales per hit.

Honestly speaking this doesn't come as an surprise to me, as just from the state of the game you can write off certain ADC to do well;

1. Ashe, Jinx, Kogmaw, Jhin and Varus are to immobile against the meta lethality divers/assassins.
2. Caitlynn cannot get to it's late game power as games are ending to fast.
3. With how strong poke ADC's are (MF/Ez), hypercarries are hurting a bit as they come out of the laning phase pretty far behind
4. Corki is more a mid laner.

I think if they bring MF/Ezreal and lethality down a bit, ADC's winrate should get closer to each other.
